title: Getting Started with RightSeuratTools
text: tutorial guide main functions RightSeuratTools package, designed provide complementary tools Seurat package, plotting, data manipulation, . package still development, new functions added future.

title: Getting Started with RightSeuratTools
text: may install package GitHub using devtools package, , don’t , may installed using following command: installed, may install RightSeuratTools using following command:
code: install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("Alexis-Varin/RightSeuratTools")

title: Getting Started with RightSeuratTools
text: tutorial, use pbmc3k dataset, contains single-cell RNA-seq data peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs), made available 10X Genomics. also build Seurat’s tutorial pbmc3k dataset preprocess , available reference . Let’s start loading packages using vignette: Next, load pbmc3k dataset using first function RightSeuratTools, Right_Data, handles data preparation us, check contents: Since object seems contain ‘data’ layer well cell annotations, unsure extent preprocessed processed, also test another function RightSeuratTools, Right_DietSeurat, reworked version DietSeurat, remove layers slots object, leaving counts layer RNA assay. also remove meta.data columns except ‘orig.ident’ metadata truly start anew. Right_DietSeurat highly customizable, check documentation information:
code: library(RightSeuratTools) library(Seurat) library(ggplot2) # Checking available datasets Right_Data(list.datasets = TRUE)  # Loading the data pbmc3k <- Right_Data("pbmc3k")  # Checking the contents of the object pbmc3k colnames(pbmc3k@meta.data) #> Available datasets: #> "pbmc3k"   a Seurat v4 object of 2700 cells by 13714 features #> An object of class Seurat  #> 13714 features across 2700 samples within 1 assay  #> Active assay: RNA (13714 features, 0 variable features) #>  2 layers present: counts, data #> [1] "orig.ident"         "nCount_RNA"         "nFeature_RNA"       #> [4] "seurat_annotations" # Reducing the object to the counts layer and the 'orig.ident' metadata pbmc3k <- Right_DietSeurat(pbmc3k, idents = "orig.ident")  # Checking the contents of the object pbmc3k colnames(pbmc3k@meta.data) #> An object of class Seurat  #> 13714 features across 2700 samples within 1 assay  #> Active assay: RNA (13714 features, 0 variable features) #>  1 layer present: counts #> [1] "orig.ident"   "nCount_RNA"   "nFeature_RNA"

title: Getting Started with RightSeuratTools
text: now move preprocessing. start calculating percentage mitochondrial genes plot results alongside number genes (nFeature_RNA) counts (nCount_RNA) per cell:  Based plot , filter cells 10% mitochondrial genes well cells less 400 2500 genes:
code: # Calculate percentage of mitochondrial genes pbmc3k[["percent.mt"]] <- PercentageFeatureSet(pbmc3k, pattern = "^MT-")  # Plot QC ggplot(pbmc3k@meta.data, aes(x = nCount_RNA, y = nFeature_RNA, col = percent.mt)) +    geom_point(size=0.5) +    scale_color_gradientn(colors=c("black","blue","green3","yellow3","red3")) +   ggtitle("pbmc3k QC metrics") +   labs(x = "Log10(counts)", y = "Log10(number of genes)", col = "% mito") +   scale_y_log10() +   scale_x_log10() +   theme_bw() +   theme(panel.border = element_blank(),         panel.grid.major = element_blank(),         panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),         axis.line = element_line(colour = "black")) # Filter cells pbmc3k <- subset(pbmc3k, subset = nFeature_RNA > 400 &                               nFeature_RNA < 2500 &                               percent.mt < 10)  # Checking the contents of the object pbmc3k #> An object of class Seurat  #> 13714 features across 2595 samples within 1 assay  #> Active assay: RNA (13714 features, 0 variable features) #>  1 layer present: counts

title: Getting Started with RightSeuratTools
text: Now filtered cells, move next step, normalizing, scaling data identifying highly variable genes. convenience, use parameters Seurat tutorial:
code: # Normalizing the data with default parameters pbmc3k <- NormalizeData(pbmc3k)  # Find highly variable genes with default parameters pbmc3k <- FindVariableFeatures(pbmc3k)  # Scaling all genes, by default it only scales the variable features pbmc3k <- ScaleData(pbmc3k, features = rownames(pbmc3k))

title: Getting Started with RightSeuratTools
text: Next, perform dimensionality reduction unsupervised clustering. use parameters Seurat tutorial: Finally, plot UMAP, concludes preprocessing steps:  Interestingly, compared Seurat tutorial, missing platelet cluster, likely due fact drastic cutoff number genes per cell, 400 versus 200. good example preprocessing steps can influence clustering results.
code: # Perform PCA pbmc3k <- RunPCA(pbmc3k)  # Clustering pbmc3k <- FindNeighbors(pbmc3k, dims = 1:10) pbmc3k <- FindClusters(pbmc3k, resolution = 0.5)  # UMAP pbmc3k <- RunUMAP(pbmc3k, dims = 1:10) # Plot UMAP DimPlot(pbmc3k)

title: Getting Started with RightSeuratTools
text: growing number methods exist label single-cell clusters, using reference datasets SingleR package Azimuth, querying ChatGPT GPTCelltype package, via using canonical markers scientific literature. vast majority methods need set genes input, determining differentially expressed genes (DEG) cluster common first step. purpose, going use function RightSeuratTools, Find_Annotation_Markers, wrapper function around FindMarkers. designed default conveniently output character vector top 5 markers, chosen based highest average log fold change genes expressed least 25% cells cluster, mitochondrial, ribosomal non-coding genes excluded, order maximize chances finding canonical markers unsupervised manner. also provides many parameters can used tailor function specific needs: markers may directly used plotting. Since Seurat tutorial uses DoHeatmap, compare equivalent RightSeuratTools, Cell_Heatmap, reworked using ComplexHeatmap instead ggplot2:  Let’s compare Seurat’s default heatmap function:  heatmaps look similar aside colors, purpose default parameters, Cell_Heatmap truly shines complexity offering customization options, possibility cluster features, apply k-means, split identities another metadata…
code: # Top 5 markers for each cluster, we will name each marker with cluster identity annotation.markers <- Find_Annotation_Markers(pbmc3k,                                               name.features = TRUE)  # Display markers for each cluster annotation.markers #> Finding markers for cluster 0 against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster 1 against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster 2 against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster 3 against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster 4 against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster 5 against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster 6 against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster 7 against all other clusters #>  [1] "CCR7"     "LEF1"     "MAL"      "PIK3IP1"  "TCF7"     "FOLR3"    #>  [7] "S100A12"  "S100A8"   "S100A9"   "CD14"     "AQP3"     "CD40LG"   #> [13] "CORO1B"   "CD2"      "TRAT1"    "VPREB3"   "CD79A"    "TCL1A"    #> [19] "FCRLA"    "FCER2"    "GZMK"     "GZMH"     "CCL5"     "CD8A"     #> [25] "KLRG1"    "CKB"      "CDKN1C"   "MS4A4A"   "HES4"     "BATF3"    #> [31] "AKR1C3"   "GNLY"     "GZMB"     "SH2D1B"   "SPON2"    "SERPINF1" #> [37] "FCER1A"   "CLIC2"    "ENHO"     "CLEC10A" Cell_Heatmap(pbmc3k,              features = annotation.markers,              cluster.features = FALSE,              show.idents.legend = FALSE) DoHeatmap(pbmc3k,           features = annotation.markers) +    NoLegend()

title: Getting Started with RightSeuratTools
text: now annotate cluster corresponding cell type display UMAP:
code: # Annotate clusters new.cluster.ids <- c("Naive CD4 T", "CD14+ Mono", "Memory CD4 T",                      "B", "CD8 T", "FCGR3A+ Mono", "NK", "DC")  names(new.cluster.ids) <- levels(pbmc3k) pbmc3k <- RenameIdents(pbmc3k, new.cluster.ids)  # Add metadata to Seurat object pbmc3k@meta.data$named_clusters <- pbmc3k@active.ident  # Plot UMAP with cell types DimPlot(pbmc3k, reduction = "umap", label = TRUE, pt.size = 0.5) +   NoLegend()

title: Getting Started with RightSeuratTools
text: Following cell annotation, one often want visualize proportion cell type. using table identities gives information, often tedious organize data plotting; RightSeuratTools introduces Barplot_Cell_Proportion, automates cell proportion conveniently displays bar plot, possibility group /split based metadata, many parameters:
code: Barplot_Cell_Proportion(pbmc3k,                         percent = FALSE)

title: Getting Started with RightSeuratTools
text: conclude showing last two visualization functions; DotPlot_Heatmap, reworked version DotPlot, also built ComplexHeatmap instead ggplot2, Grid_VlnPlot, stacked version VlnPlot square grid, also offering many options Seurat counterparts:  Comparing Seurat’s default dotplot function:  finally, grid violin plot:
code: # We will disable some parameters to be as close as possible from Seurat's DotPlot # Due to the number of features, we will also lower dots size and flip the axis DotPlot_Heatmap(pbmc3k,                 features = annotation.markers,                 dots.size = 2,                 cluster.features = FALSE,                 cluster.idents = FALSE,                 rotate.axis = TRUE) # Seurat's DotPlot function does not work well with named features, we will remove names DotPlot(pbmc3k,         features = unname(annotation.markers)) +    RotatedAxis() +    coord_flip() Grid_VlnPlot(pbmc3k,              features = annotation.markers)

what: Bar plot of the proportion of cells in each identity — Barplot_Cell_Proportion
title: Bar plot of the proportion of cells in each identity — Barplot_Cell_Proportion
text: function generates barplot proportion cells Seurat object.

title: Bar plot of the proportion of cells in each identity — Barplot_Cell_Proportion
code: Barplot_Cell_Proportion(   seurat_object,   group.by = NULL,   split.by = NULL,   colors = NULL,   order.proportion = NULL,   order.group = NULL,   order.split = NULL,   order.colors = TRUE,   alpha = 1,   show.cellsum.label = TRUE,   cellsum.label.size = 3,   axis.text.size = 9,   x.axis.angle = 60,   x.axis.hjust = 1,   y.axis.title.size = 11,   legend.text.size = 9,   legend.side = "bottom",   show.legend = TRUE,   split.plot.title.size = 24,   percent = TRUE,   nrow = 1,   unique.group.plot = TRUE,   unique.split.plot = FALSE )

title: Bar plot of the proportion of cells in each identity — Barplot_Cell_Proportion
text: seurat_object Seurat object. group.Character. name identity meta.data slot group active.ident identity stacked barplot. split.Character. name identity meta.data slot split active.ident identity separate ggplot objects. colors Character. vector colors use active.ident identity, length number identities active.ident identity. NULL, uses Seurat's default colors. order.proportion Character Numeric. vector specifying either 'reverse' levels (character numeric values corresponding indexes) active.ident identity order cells. order.group Character. vector specifying either 'reverse' levels group.identity order cells. Ignored group.= NULL. order.split Character. vector specifying either 'reverse' levels split.identity order cells. Ignored split.= NULL. order.colors Logical. TRUE, colors active.ident identity, group.identity split.identity automatically ordered according order.idents, order.group order.split. Ignored order.idents, order.group order.split NULL. alpha Numeric. transparency bars colors. value 0 1. show.cellsum.label Logical. TRUE, cell sum identity shown top bar. cellsum.label.size Numeric. font size cell sum label. Ignored show.cellsum.label = FALSE. axis.text.size Numeric. font size identities names cell percent numbers. x.axis.angle Numeric. angle rotation identities names. x.axis.hjust Numeric. horizontal justification identities names. y.axis.title.size Numeric. font size y axis title. legend.text.size Numeric. font size legend text. Ignored show.legend = FALSE. legend.side Character. side legend displayed, either 'left', 'right', 'top' 'bottom'. Ignored show.legend = FALSE. show.legend Logical. TRUE, shows legend. split.plot.title.size Numeric. font size split plots titles. Ignored split.= NULL. percent Logical. TRUE, proportion cells shown percentage total cells identity. nrow Numeric. number rows patchwork. Ignored group.= NULL split.= NULL. unique.group.plot Logical. TRUE, stacked barplots gathered single ggplot object. unique.split.plot Logical. TRUE, ggplot objects gathered single patchwork.

title: Bar plot of the proportion of cells in each identity — Barplot_Cell_Proportion
text: ggplot object, list ggplot objects, patchwork ggplot objects list patchworks ggplot objects.

title: Bar plot of the proportion of cells in each identity — Barplot_Cell_Proportion
code: # Prepare data pbmc3k <- Right_Data("pbmc3k")  # Example 1: default parameters Barplot_Cell_Proportion(pbmc3k,                         percent = FALSE)

what: Heatmap of gene expression in each cell — Cell_Heatmap
title: Heatmap of gene expression in each cell — Cell_Heatmap
text: function generates heatmap visualize expression features cell Seurat object. Credits Ming Tang initial idea replicate DoHeatmap using ComplexHeatmap. Various new parameters added offer flexibility customization.

title: Heatmap of gene expression in each cell — Cell_Heatmap
code: Cell_Heatmap(   seurat_object,   assay = "RNA",   layer = "data",   features,   split.by = NULL,   idents = NULL,   split.idents = NULL,   scale = TRUE,   rescale = FALSE,   rescale.range = c(0, 3),   rotate.axis = FALSE,   col.min = ifelse(isTRUE(scale), -2, 0),   col.max = ifelse(isTRUE(scale), 2, "q100"),   data.colors = if (isTRUE(scale)) c("#35A5FF", "white", "red") else "Viridis",   palette.reverse = FALSE,   na.color = "grey40",   idents.colors = NULL,   show.idents.names.colors = TRUE,   show.idents.oppo.colors = FALSE,   split.colors = NULL,   show.split.names.colors = TRUE,   show.split.oppo.colors = FALSE,   order.idents = NULL,   order.split = NULL,   order.colors = TRUE,   kmeans.repeats = 100,   shuffle.cells = TRUE,   cluster.cells = FALSE,   cluster.features = TRUE,   features.kmeans = 1,   features.kmeans.numbers.size = 11,   idents.gap = 1,   features.gap = 1,   idents.names.size = 9,   features.names.size = 9,   features.names.style = "italic",   row.names.side = "left",   row.names.width = unit(15, "cm"),   column.names.angle = 45,   column.names.side = "top",   column.names.height = unit(15, "cm"),   outer.border = TRUE,   data.legend.name = ifelse(isTRUE(scale), "Z-Score", "Expression"),   data.legend.side = "bottom",   data.legend.direction = "horizontal",   data.legend.position = "topcenter",   data.legend.width = 5,   idents.legend.name = "Clusters",   show.idents.legend = TRUE,   split.legend.name = split.by,   show.split.legend = TRUE,   legend.title.size = 10,   legend.text.size = 10,   legend.gap = 10,   raster = ifelse(ncol(seurat_object) > 3000, TRUE, FALSE),   raster.quality = 10,   output.data = FALSE,   ... )

title: Heatmap of gene expression in each cell — Cell_Heatmap
text: seurat_object Seurat object. assay Character. Seurat object contains multiple RNA assays, may specify one use (example 'RNA2' created second RNA assay named 'RNA2'. See Seurat v5 vignettes information). may also use another assay 'SCT' pull features expression . layer Character. Formerly known slot. recommended use 'data'. features Character. vector features plot. split.Character. name identity meta.data slot split active.ident identity . idents Character. vector one several identities names active.ident identity use want (instead subsetting object). NULL, identities used. split.idents Character. vector one several identities names split.identity use want . NULL, identities used. scale Logical. TRUE, cell expression values feature scaled using scale default parameters. resulting values Z-scores (mean subtracted values divided standard deviation) positive cell expression values anymore, positive negative values displayed, depending expression particular cell mean expression cells (calculated independently feature). rescale Logical. TRUE, cell expression values adjusted using rescale first numerical value rescale.range parameter (lowest expression) second numerical value (highest expression) feature. different scale compare values mean standard deviation therefore Z-score, refits cell expression value (independently feature) order visualize features dimension regardless differences levels expression. Ignored scale = TRUE. rescale.range Numeric. vector specifying minimum maximum values resize cell expression values internally passed rescale. values arbitrary change visualization, values legend, need adjust col.min col.max parameters influence color scale. Ignored rescale = FALSE scale = TRUE. rotate.axis Logical. TRUE, flips axis, features displayed columns identities rows. col.min Character Numeric. minimum value breaks parameter internally passed colorRamp2. character, must quantile form 'qX' X number 0 100. value 'q5' 'q10' useful reduce effect outlier values (e.g. low value significantly alters color scale range values). col.max Character Numeric. maximum value breaks parameter internally passed colorRamp2. character, must quantile form 'qX' X number 0 100. value 'q95' 'q90' useful reduce effect outlier values (e.g. high value significantly alters color scale range values). data.colors Character. Either character vector exactly 3 colors, corresponding lowest, zero (middle scale = FALSE), highest values expression matrix internally passed colorRamp2, single character value corresponding name palette internally passed hcl_palette parameter colorRamp2 ('Inferno', 'Berlin', 'Viridis' etc, check hcl.pals palettes available). palette.reverse Logical. TRUE data.colors palette ('Viridis'), function reverse colors. na.color Character. color use missing values (NA). idents.colors Character. vector colors use active.ident identity, length number identities active.ident identity supplied idents parameter. NULL, uses Seurat's default colors. show.idents.names.colors Logical. TRUE, function display colors specified idents.colors parameter next identities names. show.idents.oppo.colors Logical. TRUE, function display colors specified idents.colors parameter opposite side identities names. split.colors Character. vector colors use split.identity, length number identities split.identity supplied split.idents parameter. NULL, uses custom set colors colors. Ignored split.= NULL. show.split.names.colors Logical. TRUE, function display colors specified split.colors parameter next identities names. Ignored split.= NULL. show.split.oppo.colors Logical. TRUE, function display colors specified split.colors parameter opposite side identities names. Ignored split.= NULL. order.idents Character Numeric. vector specifying either 'reverse' levels (character numeric values corresponding indexes) active.ident identity order cells. order.split Character Numeric. vector specifying either 'reverse' levels (character numeric values corresponding indexes) split.identity order cells. Ignored split.= NULL. order.colors Logical. TRUE, colors active.ident identity split.identity automatically ordered according order.idents order.split. Ignored order.idents order.split NULL. kmeans.repeats Numeric. number k-means runs get consensus k-means clustering. Ignored features.kmeans = 1. shuffle.cells Logical. TRUE, function randomize distribution cells identity. Useful smooth expression, limits visible batch effect (cells merged Seurat object typically ordered based levels 'orig.ident' identity, might lead unwanted patterns expression another identity). Note values modified, changes order cells identity. Ignored cluster.cells = TRUE. cluster.cells Logical. TRUE, function cluster cells within identity. opposite effect shuffle.cells, order cells based expression similarity therefore increase batch effect. Useful visualize , within identity, subset cells expressing features rest cells , vice versa. Just like shuffle.cells, values modified, changes order cells identity. cluster.features Logical Function. TRUE, function cluster features. may also pass hclust dendrogram object contains clustering. features.kmeans Numeric. number k-means slices use features clustering. features.kmeans.numbers.size Numeric. font size features k-means slices numbers. Set 0 remove . idents.gap Numeric. gap identities slices. features.gap Numeric. gap features slices. Ignored features.kmeans = 1. idents.names.size Numeric. font size identities names. Set 0 remove . features.names.size Numeric. font size features names. Set 0 remove . features.names.style Character. font face features names. Gene nomenclature used almost scientific journals require features names italicized, therefore parameter default set 'italic'. Use 'plain' revert back regular font face. row.names.side Character. side row names displayed, either 'left' 'right'. dendrogram displayed opposite side. row.names.width Numeric. width row names. Increase parameter row names truncated. column.names.angle Numeric. angle rotation column names. column.names.side Character. side column names displayed, either 'top' 'bottom'. dendrogram displayed opposite side. column.names.height Numeric. height column names. Increase parameter column names truncated. outer.border Logical. TRUE, function display outer border around slice. data.legend.name Character. name data legend. data.legend.side Character. side data legend displayed, either 'left', 'right', 'top' 'bottom'. data.legend.direction Character. direction data legend, either 'horizontal' 'vertical'. data.legend.position Character. centering data legend name, many options, default option Heatmap 'topleft'. data.legend.width Numeric. long data legend , affects data legend data.legend.direction = 'horizontal'. idents.legend.name Character. name active.ident identity legend. Ignored show.idents.names.colors show.idents.oppo.colors FALSE. show.idents.legend Logical. TRUE, function display legend active.ident identity. Ignored show.idents.names.colors show.idents.oppo.colors FALSE. split.legend.name Character. name split.identity legend. Ignored split.= NULL. Ignored show.split.names.colors show.split.oppo.colors FALSE. show.split.legend Logical. TRUE, function display legend split.identity. Ignored show.split.names.colors show.split.oppo.colors FALSE. legend.title.size Numeric. font size legend titles. legend.text.size Numeric. font size legend texts. legend.gap Numeric. gap legends plot. parameter sets value global options ht_opt, affect Heatmap objects R session. Use ComplexHeatmap::ht_opt(RESET = TRUE) restore default parameters. raster Logical. (Heatmap documentation) TRUE, function render heatmap body raster image. helps reduce file size matrix huge. raster.quality Numeric. quality raster image. higher value slow rendering lower expression smoothing. Ignored raster = FALSE. output.data Logical. TRUE, function return matrix cell expression data, scaled , instead displaying anything. ... Additional arguments passed Heatmap, show_parent_dend_line, clustering_method_rows, etc, accepts parameter already internally passed Heatmap (example, outer.border sets border parameter Heatmap, get error try pass border parameter Cell_Heatmap).

title: Heatmap of gene expression in each cell — Cell_Heatmap
text: Heatmap object, matrix cell expression data, scaled .

title: Heatmap of gene expression in each cell — Cell_Heatmap
code: # Prepare data pbmc3k <- Right_Data("pbmc3k") pbmc3k.markers = c("CCR7", "TCF7", "S100A9", "CD14",                  "CD40LG", "CD2", "CD79A", "TCL1A",                  "CCL5", "CD8A", "CDKN1C", "MS4A4A",                  "GNLY", "GZMB")  # Example 1: default parameters Cell_Heatmap(pbmc3k,              features = pbmc3k.markers) #> One or more identities account for less than 5% of cells. #> You might experience trouble visualizing them. #> Using DotPlot_Heatmap() might be more appropriate.

what: Dot plot or heatmap of average gene expression in each identity — DotPlot_Heatmap
title: Dot plot or heatmap of average gene expression in each identity — DotPlot_Heatmap
text: function generates dotplot heatmap visualize average expression features identity Seurat object. Credits Seurat's dev team original DotPlot data processing function derived Ming Tang initial idea use ComplexHeatmap draw dotplot layer_fun function draws dots. Various new parameters added offer flexibility customization.

title: Dot plot or heatmap of average gene expression in each identity — DotPlot_Heatmap
code: DotPlot_Heatmap(   seurat_object,   assay = "RNA",   layer = "data",   data.are.log = TRUE,   features,   split.by = NULL,   idents = NULL,   split.idents = NULL,   scale = TRUE,   rescale = FALSE,   rescale.range = c(0, 3),   rotate.axis = FALSE,   dotplot = TRUE,   dots.type = "square root",   dots.size = 4,   show.noexpr.dots = FALSE,   col.min = ifelse(isTRUE(scale), -2, 0),   col.max = ifelse(isTRUE(scale), 2, "q100"),   data.colors = if (isTRUE(scale)) c("#35A5FF", "white", "red") else "Viridis",   palette.reverse = FALSE,   na.color = "grey40",   background.color = "white",   idents.colors = NULL,   show.idents.names.colors = FALSE,   show.idents.oppo.colors = TRUE,   split.colors = NULL,   show.split.names.colors = FALSE,   show.split.oppo.colors = TRUE,   order.idents = NULL,   order.split = NULL,   order.colors = TRUE,   kmeans.repeats = 100,   cluster.idents = TRUE,   idents.kmeans = 1,   idents.kmeans.numbers.size = 11,   cluster.features = TRUE,   features.kmeans = 1,   features.kmeans.numbers.size = 11,   idents.gap = 1,   features.gap = 1,   idents.names.size = 9,   features.names.size = 9,   features.names.style = "italic",   row.names.side = "left",   row.names.width = unit(15, "cm"),   column.names.angle = 45,   column.names.side = "bottom",   column.names.height = unit(15, "cm"),   inner.border = TRUE,   outer.border = TRUE,   data.legend.name = ifelse(isTRUE(scale), "Z-Score", "Average Expression"),   data.legend.side = "bottom",   data.legend.direction = "horizontal",   data.legend.position = "topcenter",   data.legend.width = 5,   idents.legend.name = "Clusters",   show.idents.legend = TRUE,   split.legend.name = split.by,   show.split.legend = TRUE,   legend.title.size = 10,   legend.text.size = 10,   legend.gap = 10,   output.data = FALSE,   ... )

title: Dot plot or heatmap of average gene expression in each identity — DotPlot_Heatmap
text: seurat_object Seurat object. assay Character. Seurat object contains multiple RNA assays, may specify one use (example 'RNA2' created second RNA assay named 'RNA2'. See Seurat v5 vignettes information). may also use another assay 'SCT' pull features expression . layer Character. Formerly known slot. recommended use 'data'. data..log Logical. TRUE, tells function data log transformed. , , layer = 'data', cell expression values exponentiated (using expm1) averaging done non-log space (per DotPlot AverageExpression's default behavior), , average expression values log transformed back (using log1p). FALSE, layer = 'scale.data' 'counts', cell expression values exponentiated prior averaging. features Character. vector features plot. split.Character. name identity meta.data slot split active.ident identity . idents Character. vector one several identities names active.ident identity use want (instead subsetting object). NULL, identities used. split.idents Character. vector one several identities names split.identity use want . NULL, identities used. scale Logical. TRUE, average expression values feature scaled using scale default parameters. resulting values Z-scores (mean subtracted values divided standard deviation) positive average expression values anymore, positive negative values displayed, depending average expression particular identity mean average expression identities (calculated independently feature). Caution exercised interpreting results low number identities (typically 5), small differences average expression might lead exacerbated differences scaled. rescale Logical. TRUE, average expression values adjusted using rescale first numerical value rescale.range parameter (lowest expression) second numerical value (highest expression) feature. different scale compare values mean standard deviation therefore Z-score, refits average expression value (independently feature) order visualize features dimension regardless differences levels expression. Caution exercised interpreting results low number identities (typically 5), small differences average expression might lead exacerbated differences rescaled. Ignored scale = TRUE. rescale.range Numeric. vector specifying minimum maximum values resize average expression values internally passed rescale. values arbitrary change visualization, values legend, need adjust col.min col.max parameters influence color scale. Ignored rescale = FALSE scale = TRUE. rotate.axis Logical. TRUE, flips axis, features displayed rows identities columns. dotplot Logical. TRUE, function display dotplot, dots size proportional percentage cells expressing feature. FALSE, function instead display heatmap. dots.type Character. Determines dots size difference 0 100% expression. Either 'square root' (lower difference) 'radius' (higher difference). Ignored dotplot = FALSE. dots.size Numeric. size dots dotplot. Decreasing parameter helps displaying large number features. Ignored dotplot = FALSE. show.noexpr.dots Logical. TRUE, function display small dot features 0% expression instead nothing. Ignored dotplot = FALSE. col.min Character Numeric. minimum value breaks parameter internally passed colorRamp2. character, must quantile form 'qX' X number 0 100. value 'q5' 'q10' useful reduce effect outlier values (e.g. low value significantly alters color scale range values). col.max Character Numeric. maximum value breaks parameter internally passed colorRamp2. character, must quantile form 'qX' X number 0 100. value 'q95' 'q90' useful reduce effect outlier values (e.g. high value significantly alters color scale range values). data.colors Character. Either character vector exactly 3 colors, corresponding lowest, zero (middle scale = FALSE), highest values expression matrix internally passed colorRamp2, single character value corresponding name palette internally passed hcl_palette parameter colorRamp2 ('Inferno', 'Berlin', 'Viridis' etc, check hcl.pals palettes available). palette.reverse Logical. TRUE data.colors palette ('Viridis'), function reverse colors. na.color Character. color use missing values (NA). background.color Character. color use background behind dots. Ignored dotplot = FALSE. idents.colors Character. vector colors use active.ident identity, length number identities active.ident identity supplied idents parameter. NULL, uses Seurat's default colors. show.idents.names.colors Logical. TRUE, function display colors specified idents.colors parameter next identities names. show.idents.oppo.colors Logical. TRUE, function display colors specified idents.colors parameter opposite side identities names. split.colors Character. vector colors use split.identity, length number identities split.identity supplied split.idents parameter. NULL, uses custom set colors colors. Ignored split.= NULL. show.split.names.colors Logical. TRUE, function display colors specified split.colors parameter next identities names. Ignored split.= NULL. show.split.oppo.colors Logical. TRUE, function display colors specified split.colors parameter opposite side identities names. Ignored split.= NULL. order.idents Character Numeric. vector specifying either 'reverse' levels (character numeric values corresponding indexes) active.ident identity order cells. cluster.idents = TRUE Function, legend names ordered. order.split Character Numeric. vector specifying either 'reverse' levels (character numeric values corresponding indexes) split.identity order cells. cluster.idents = TRUE Function, legend names ordered. Ignored split.= NULL. order.colors Logical. TRUE, colors active.ident identity split.identity automatically ordered according order.idents order.split. Ignored order.idents order.split NULL. kmeans.repeats Numeric. number k-means runs get consensus k-means clustering. Ignored idents.kmeans features.kmeans equal 1. cluster.idents Logical Function. TRUE, function cluster identities. may also pass hclust dendrogram object contains clustering. idents.kmeans Numeric. number k-means slices use identities clustering. idents.kmeans.numbers.size Numeric. font size identities k-means slices numbers. Set 0 remove . cluster.features Logical Function. TRUE, function cluster features. may also pass hclust dendrogram object contains clustering. features.kmeans Numeric. number k-means slices use features clustering. features.kmeans.numbers.size Numeric. font size features k-means slices numbers. Set 0 remove . idents.gap Numeric. gap identities slices. Ignored idents.kmeans = 1. features.gap Numeric. gap features slices. Ignored features.kmeans = 1. idents.names.size Numeric. font size identities names. Set 0 remove . features.names.size Numeric. font size features names. Set 0 remove . features.names.style Character. font face features names. Gene nomenclature used almost scientific journals require features names italicized, therefore parameter default set 'italic'. Use 'plain' revert back regular font face. row.names.side Character. side row names displayed, either 'left' 'right'. dendrogram displayed opposite side. row.names.width Numeric. width row names. Increase parameter row names truncated. column.names.angle Numeric. angle rotation column names. column.names.side Character. side column names displayed, either 'top' 'bottom'. dendrogram displayed opposite side. column.names.height Numeric. height column names. Increase parameter column names truncated. inner.border Logical. TRUE, function display black outline around dot dotplot = TRUE, black border around cell heatmap dotplot = FALSE. outer.border Logical. TRUE, function display outer border around plot around slice idents.kmeans /features.kmeans higher 1. data.legend.name Character. name data legend. data.legend.side Character. side data legend displayed, either 'left', 'right', 'top' 'bottom'. data.legend.direction Character. direction data legend, either 'horizontal' 'vertical'. data.legend.position Character. centering data legend name, many options, default option Heatmap 'topleft'. data.legend.width Numeric. long data legend , affects data legend data.legend.direction = 'horizontal'. idents.legend.name Character. name active.ident identity legend. Ignored show.idents.names.colors show.idents.oppo.colors FALSE. show.idents.legend Logical. TRUE, function display legend active.ident identity. Ignored show.idents.names.colors show.idents.oppo.colors FALSE. split.legend.name Character. name split.identity legend. Ignored split.= NULL. Ignored show.split.names.colors show.split.oppo.colors FALSE. show.split.legend Logical. TRUE, function display legend split.identity. Ignored show.split.names.colors show.split.oppo.colors FALSE. legend.title.size Numeric. font size legend titles. legend.text.size Numeric. font size legend texts. legend.gap Numeric. gap legends plot. parameter sets value global options ht_opt, affect Heatmap objects R session. Use ComplexHeatmap::ht_opt(RESET = TRUE) restore default parameters. output.data Logical. TRUE, function return list containing matrix average expression data, scaled , another matrix containing percentage cells expressing feature, instead displaying anything. ... Additional arguments passed Heatmap, show_parent_dend_line, clustering_method_rows, etc, accepts parameter already internally passed Heatmap (example, outer.border sets border parameter Heatmap, get error try pass border parameter DotPlot_Heatmap).

title: Dot plot or heatmap of average gene expression in each identity — DotPlot_Heatmap
text: Heatmap object, either dotplot, heatmap, list containing matrix average expression data, scaled , another matrix containing percentage cells expressing feature.

title: Dot plot or heatmap of average gene expression in each identity — DotPlot_Heatmap
code: # Prepare data pbmc3k <- Right_Data("pbmc3k") pbmc3k.markers = c("CCR7", "TCF7", "CD14",                  "CD79A", "CD8A", "CDKN1C",                  "GZMB", "CLEC10A")  # Example 1: default parameters DotPlot_Heatmap(pbmc3k,                 features = pbmc3k.markers)

what: Get the top markers for fast annotation — Find_Annotation_Markers
title: Get the top markers for fast annotation — Find_Annotation_Markers
text: function wrapper around FindMarkers allows parallelization filtering mitochondrial, ribosomal non-coding RNA features human, well filtering pseudogenes mouse. also directly return top X markers identity.

title: Get the top markers for fast annotation — Find_Annotation_Markers
code: Find_Annotation_Markers(   seurat_object,   ident.1 = NULL,   ident.2 = NULL,   min.pct = 0.25,   top.markers = 5,   unique.markers = TRUE,   filter.mito = TRUE,   filter.ribo = TRUE,   filter.ncRNA = TRUE,   species = "human",   parallelized = FALSE,   BPPARAM = NULL,   name.features = FALSE,   output.df = FALSE,   output.list = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: Get the top markers for fast annotation — Find_Annotation_Markers
text: seurat_object Seurat object. ident.1 Character. (FindMarkers documentation) Identity class define markers ; pass object class phylo 'clustertree' find markers node cluster tree; passing 'clustertree' requires BuildClusterTree run. Leave NULL find markers clusters. ident.2 Character. (FindMarkers documentation) second identity class comparison; NULL, use cells comparison; object class phylo 'clustertree' passed ident.1, must pass node find markers . min.pct Numeric. (FindMarkers documentation) test features detected minimum fraction min.pct cells either two populations. Meant speed function testing features infrequently expressed. top.markers Numeric. number top markers return. set Inf, markers returned. unique.markers Logical. TRUE, unique markers returned identity order prevent features repeated multiple times. filter.mito Logical. TRUE, mitochondrial features filtered . filter.ribo Logical. TRUE, ribosomal features filtered . filter.ncRNA Logical. TRUE, non-coding RNA features filtered . species Character. species pull data filter features. 'human', non-coding RNA features filtered dataset named ncRNA_human built genenames database. 'mouse', pseudogenes filtered based dataset named pseudogenes_mouse built dreamBase2 database. datasets loaded RightSeuratTools may checked information. parallelized Logical. TRUE, FindMarkers parallelized using BiocParallel. Please note parallelization complex depends system operating system (Windows users might see gain might even experience slowdown). BPPARAM BiocParallelParam object used parallelization. NULL, function set parameter SerialParam, uses single worker (core) therefore parallelized, order prevent accidental use large computation resources. Ignored parallelized = FALSE. name.features Logical. TRUE, output.df output.list FALSE, feature named corresponding cluster identity. output.df Logical. TRUE, data frame features names associated statistics returned. FALSE, character vector features names returned. output.list Logical. TRUE, list data frames identity features names statistics list character vectors containing features names output.df = FALSE returned. verbose Logical. FALSE, print progress messages output, warnings errors still printed. ... Additional arguments passed FindMarkers, test.use, passed methods specific DE methods.

title: Get the top markers for fast annotation — Find_Annotation_Markers
text: data frame list data frames features names associated statistics, character vector list character vectors features names.

title: Get the top markers for fast annotation — Find_Annotation_Markers
code: # Prepare data pbmc3k <- Right_Data("pbmc3k")  # Example 1: default parameters pbmc3k.markers <- Find_Annotation_Markers(pbmc3k) #> Finding markers for cluster Naive CD4 T against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster Memory CD4 T against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster CD14+ Mono against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster B against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster CD8 T against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster FCGR3A+ Mono against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster NK against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster DC against all other clusters head(pbmc3k.markers) #> [1] "CCR7"    "LEF1"    "MAL"     "PIK3IP1" "TCF7"    "AQP3"     # Example 2: parallelized FindAllMarkers BPPARAM <- BiocParallel::registered()[[1]] if (BPPARAM$workers > 4) BPPARAM$workers <- 4 pbmc3k.markers <- Find_Annotation_Markers(pbmc3k,                                           min.pct = 0.01,                                           top.markers = Inf,                                           unique.markers = FALSE,                                           filter.mito = FALSE,                                           filter.ribo = FALSE,                                           filter.ncRNA = FALSE,                                           parallelized = TRUE,                                           BPPARAM = BPPARAM,                                           output.df = TRUE) #> Finding markers for cluster Naive CD4 T against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster Memory CD4 T against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster CD14+ Mono against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster B against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster CD8 T against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster FCGR3A+ Mono against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster NK against all other clusters #> Finding markers for cluster DC against all other clusters head(pbmc3k.markers) #>                p_val avg_log2FC pct.1 pct.2    p_val_adj     cluster feature #> GTSCR1  1.989750e-08   7.150823 0.016 0.000 2.728743e-04 Naive CD4 T  GTSCR1 #> REG4    5.397233e-10   5.889242 0.022 0.001 7.401765e-06 Naive CD4 T    REG4 #> NOG     2.006355e-12   4.827114 0.034 0.003 2.751516e-08 Naive CD4 T     NOG #> MMP28   1.977007e-07   4.367551 0.016 0.001 2.711268e-03 Naive CD4 T   MMP28 #> C2orf40 1.025794e-07   3.843510 0.020 0.002 1.406773e-03 Naive CD4 T C2orf40 #> ADTRP   1.534399e-22   2.916404 0.099 0.017 2.104275e-18 Naive CD4 T   ADTRP

what: Compute gene signatures from GSEA — GSEA_Signatures
title: Compute gene signatures from GSEA — GSEA_Signatures
text: function creates signatures (module scores calculated UCell Seurat's respective functions) features found Seurat object extracted supplied MSigDB's pathways.

title: Compute gene signatures from GSEA — GSEA_Signatures
code: GSEA_Signatures(   seurat_object,   assay = "RNA",   layer = "data",   species = "Homo sapiens",   category = NULL,   subcategory = NULL,   pathways,   min.features = 2,   signatures.names = "name",   method = "UCell",   only.features = FALSE,   fail.safe = 10,   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: Compute gene signatures from GSEA — GSEA_Signatures
text: seurat_object Seurat object. assay Character. Seurat object contains multiple RNA assays, may specify one use (example 'RNA2' created second RNA assay named 'RNA2'. See Seurat v5 vignettes information). may also use another assay 'SCT' pull features expression . layer Character. Formerly known slot. split layers function always join searching features adding signatures. species Character. species name passed msigdbr build pathways database. Use msigdbr_species list available species. category Character. category categories passed msigdbr build pathways database. Use msigdbr_collections list available categories (gs_cat column). NULL, categories used. subcategory Character. subcategory subcategories passed msigdbr build pathways database. Use msigdbr_collections list available subcategories (gs_subcat column). NULL, subcategories used. pathways Character. names pathways used create signatures. may provide either pathway id (example, 'GO:0006574') name matching pattern found gs_name column (caps underscores words). Please note may also provide partial match (example, 'TYPE_I_INTERFERON') function find pathways containing partial string. Beware may result large number pathways added signatures (using .features = TRUE highly recommended) handy explore pathways interest particular biological process. min.features Numeric. minimum number features present Seurat object pathway considered. signatures.names Character. Either 'id' add pathways ids signatures (e.g. GO:0004657, hsa05200 etc), 'name' add pathways names signatures, might long. may also provide vector custom names used signatures names Seurat object, whose length must match number pathways. multiple results found pathway, function append number corresponding signature name result. method Character. method want use calculate module scores, either 'UCell' 'Seurat'. .features Logical. TRUE, function add signature Seurat object return Seurat object well features pathways found Seurat object features present Seurat object. fail.safe Numeric. maximum number signatures function attempt add Seurat object. number signatures found higher number, function add signature Seurat object return Seurat object well features pathways found Seurat object features present Seurat object. verbose Logical. FALSE, print progress messages output, warnings errors still printed. ... Additional arguments passed AddModuleScore_UCell AddModuleScore.

title: Compute gene signatures from GSEA — GSEA_Signatures
text: list containing Seurat object added signatures .features = FALSE, features pathways, features present Seurat object names signatures Seurat object.

what: Square stacked violin plot of gene expression in each identity — Grid_VlnPlot
title: Square stacked violin plot of gene expression in each identity — Grid_VlnPlot
text: function stacked violin plot optimized display features expression Seurat object grid fashion (square) instead single column like stacked violin functions available packages, resulting nicer plots easier include publications.

title: Square stacked violin plot of gene expression in each identity — Grid_VlnPlot
code: Grid_VlnPlot(   seurat_object,   assay = "RNA",   layer = "data",   features,   idents = NULL,   scale = TRUE,   rotate.axis = FALSE,   colors = NULL,   order.idents = NULL,   order.colors = TRUE,   idents.text.size = 9,   show.idents = FALSE,   features.text.size = 11,   legend.text.size = 12,   legend.side = "bottom",   show.legend = TRUE,   ncol = "square" )

title: Square stacked violin plot of gene expression in each identity — Grid_VlnPlot
text: seurat_object Seurat object. assay Character. Seurat object contains multiple RNA assays, may specify one use (example 'RNA2' created second RNA assay named 'RNA2'. See Seurat v5 vignettes information). may also use another assay 'SCT' pull features expression . layer Character. Formerly known slot. recommended use 'data'. features Character. vector features plot. idents Character. vector one several identities names active.ident identity use want (instead subsetting object). NULL, identities used. scale Logical. TRUE, scales violins max height features. rotate.axis Logical. TRUE, flips axis, displaying violins vertically instead horizontally. colors Character. vector colors use active.ident identity, length number identities active.ident identity supplied idents parameter. NULL, uses Seurat's default colors. order.idents Character Numeric. vector specifying either 'reverse' levels (character numeric values corresponding indexes) active.ident identity order cells. order.colors Logical. TRUE, colors active.ident identity automatically ordered according order.idents. Ignored order.idents = NULL. idents.text.size Numeric. font size identities names. Ignored show.idents = FALSE. show.idents Logical. TRUE, shows identities names plot. features.text.size Numeric. font size features names. legend.text.size Numeric. font size legend text. Ignored show.legend = FALSE. legend.side Character. side legend displayed, either 'left', 'right', 'top' 'bottom'. Ignored show.legend = FALSE. show.legend Logical. TRUE, shows legend. ncol Numeric. Number columns use. 'square', display features square grid close possible depending number features.

title: Square stacked violin plot of gene expression in each identity — Grid_VlnPlot
text: ggplot object.

title: Square stacked violin plot of gene expression in each identity — Grid_VlnPlot
code: # Prepare data pbmc3k <- Right_Data("pbmc3k") pbmc3k.markers <- c("CCR7", "TCF7", "S100A9", "CD14",                  "CD40LG", "CD2", "CD79A", "TCL1A",                  "CCL5", "CD8A", "CDKN1C", "MS4A4A",                  "GNLY", "GZMB", "FCER1A", "CLEC10A")  # Example 1: default parameters Grid_VlnPlot(pbmc3k,              features = pbmc3k.markers)

title: Data loader for vignettes — Right_Data
text: function downloads prepares data used vignettes, Seurat SingleCellExperiment objects. main advantage using data loader nothing stored package, therefore remains lightweight even use large objects tutorials. Anyone interested adding dataset function use package's vignettes (provided raw data can downloaded reputable source, NCBI's GEO FTP site example) can open issue GitHub.

title: Data loader for vignettes — Right_Data
code: Right_Data(dataset = NULL, list.datasets = FALSE)

title: Data loader for vignettes — Right_Data
text: dataset Character. name dataset load. list.datasets Logical. TRUE, prints list available datasets.

title: Data loader for vignettes — Right_Data
text: object various classes, depending dataset asked, message containing list available datasets.

title: Data loader for vignettes — Right_Data
code: Right_Data(list.datasets = TRUE) #> Available datasets: #> "pbmc3k"   a Seurat v4 object of 2700 cells by 13714 features  pbmc3k = Right_Data("pbmc3k") pbmc3k #> An object of class Seurat  #> 13714 features across 2700 samples within 1 assay  #> Active assay: RNA (13714 features, 0 variable features) #>  2 layers present: counts, data

what: Reduce the size of a Seurat object — Right_DietSeurat
title: Reduce the size of a Seurat object — Right_DietSeurat
text: Seurat v5 release, DietSeurat remove data scale.data layers, resulting objects little reduction size. function created purpose restore DietSeurat's proper behavior function fixed Seurat's dev team, well offer new options ability subset cells keep variable features.

title: Reduce the size of a Seurat object — Right_DietSeurat
code: Right_DietSeurat(   seurat_object,   idents = NULL,   cells = NULL,   features = NULL,   dimreducs = NULL,   graphs = NULL,   variable.features = FALSE,   misc = TRUE,   split.counts.layer = NULL,   data.layer = FALSE,   scale.layer = FALSE,   SCTAssay = FALSE )

title: Reduce the size of a Seurat object — Right_DietSeurat
text: seurat_object Seurat object. idents Character. vector one several identity names meta.data slot keep diet object. NULL, identities kept. cells Character. vector one several cell barcodes keep diet object. NULL, cells kept. features Character. vector one several feature names keep diet object. NULL, features kept. dimreducs Character. vector one several reduction names keep diet object. NULL, DimReducs removed. Note subset features remove PCs calculated, PCA kept, even set parameter, feature.loadings slot empty, intended behavior. graphs Character. vector one several graph names keep diet object. NULL, Graphs removed. variable.features Logical. TRUE, variable features slot kept diet object. Note keep subset features, variable features also subset, remove features variable features calculated, variable features kept even parameter set TRUE, intended behavior. misc Logical. TRUE, misc slot kept diet object. split.counts.layer Character. name identity meta.data slot split counts layer need downstream analysis. NULL, diet object single counts layer, even original object split counts layers. data.layer Logical. TRUE, data layer RNA assay kept diet object present. counts layer, split data layers, joined single data layer unless split.counts.layer parameter set. scale.layer Logical. TRUE, scale.data layer RNA assay kept diet object present. SCTAssay Logical. TRUE, SCT assay kept diet object present.

title: Reduce the size of a Seurat object — Right_DietSeurat
